attributes.action: Support Peace and Stability in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
attributes.additional_details: The ongoing violence in eastern DRC, particularly in North Kivu and Ituri, has led to mass displacement, human rights abuses, and a worsening humanitarian crisis. The UK, as a key international partner to both Rwanda and the DRC, must take a stronger stance to support peace efforts, prevent further escalation, and hold all parties accountable. To review and suspend military aid and security assistance to Rwanda until it ceases support for armed groups in eastern DRC as evidenced by UN reports.
attributes.background: The UK has a responsibility to support peace, security, and human rights in Central Africa. To take urgent diplomatic and humanitarian action to address the ongoing conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and Rwanda’s role in destabilising the region.
